extendedInfo.description: Something no soul winning christian should ever be without.  The Roman Road.  All of the needed bible verses from Romans that you use to lead a person to Christ.  We all should know them but if not, we don't always have our bible handy and you never know when the opportunity may arise to lead someone to Christ.  With the Roman Road on Android, you will always have them with you on your Android device.The app features a basic scrollable screen with the bible verses from Romans that are used in leading someone to Christ and also a "Sinners Prayer".  Text is resizable (larger or smaller) by pinching the screen with your two fingers just like photos.Features:* No ADs and totally free.* Uses very little memory.* Resizable Text* Simple and Easy to use.* Always with you* No Wifi or Cell needed to read textPermissions:The app requests full internet permission only because it uses a web browser to view the text.  The text is on the phone so it never actually has to use the internet.  The permission is just for the web browser.The only time the internet would ever be utilized is if you click the DPGadgets link at the very bottom of the page which goes directly to our website, if you ever felt inclined to click it.That's it. Lightweight, Free and easy.  Be a ready and prepared soul winner

reviews.title: Insufficient and Incompatible for Real Christians
reviews.comment: 1 Where in the Bible is the sinner\'s prayer? I can\'t find it or even see it\'s necessity. 2 How does the prayer save us? I thought that we were saved by faith and that nothing that we do can save us, so how is it that because we pray we get saved? 3 Why only Romans? All scripture is inspired by God (2 Tim. 3:16). Why should we follow what Paul says over Christ\'s sayings in the Gospels? 4 Is there any historical data?  In short, the app is unsatisfactory; it\'s incomplete and incompatible for Christianity.
reviews.author: Blake G.

reviews.title: Awesome! Thanks For A Life Changer!
reviews.comment: To God be the glory! No Jesus, No Peace; Know Jesus, Know God!
reviews.author: A Google User
